ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Meghna Krishnadas  Meghna was very helpful and accessible when working on my research proposal. She provides excellent insight and new perspectives on our research.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This course was incredibly helpful for developing my research proposal, as well as preparing for next year when I need to process and present my research findings.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Having a chance to listen to and provide feedback for 2nd year students' research projects. It gave me a lot of insight into what next year holds for me, and ways to prepare for the next phase of my research. It was also a valuable resource for workshopping my own research ideas.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Due to the individualized nature of the course, it sometimes led to long periods of conversation between the presenter and Mark or Meghna. This is fine, but it might be helpful to have plan concurrent activities for other students who may be waiting their turn to present.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: As a research student, this course is invaluable to preparing and working on my master's project.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was searching for some guidance in my research.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Try to participate as much as possible. The more involved you can be the more you will get out of the lab meeting.
